title: Oil Caps shut down Natives
text:
Oil Caps shut down Natives By: Uncredited Report Error 
Tyler Kirkup scored a goal for his hometown Virden Oil Capitals as they beat the Neepawa Natives 5-0 in the Manitoba Junior Hockey League on Friday. 
All of this weekend’s games are being played at Winnipeg’s MTS IcePlex as part of the league’s showcase. 
In Friday’s other games, it was: Steinbach Pistons 4, Waywayseecappo Wolverines 1; Winkler Flyers 3, Dauphin Kings 0; Portage Terriers 4, OCN Blizzard 3 in overtime; and Winnipeg Blues 3, Swan Valley Stampeders 1. 
Tristen Cross added a marker for Virden (2-2-0), while Tanner Lewis, who’s also from Virden, chipped in with three helpers. Sean Kuehn made 16 saves for the shutout. Jeremy Link made 25 saves in net for the Natives (2-2-0), who left with 5:18 remaining in the game. 
Pistons 4 Wolverines 1 
Bradley Schoonbaert of Brandon scored a pair of goals to lead the Pistons (2-1-0). Ty Enns of Cartwright replied for the Wolverines (0-3-1). His marker was set up by Rylee Zimmer of Russell and Riley Shamray of Shoal Lake. 
Flyers 3 Kings 0 
Coltyn Bates of Brandon netted a power-play marker for the Flyers (2-1-0), while Clarke Fiegel made 23 saves for his first shutout of the season. Connor Shaw, who’s from Dauphin, stopped 22 shots in net for the Kings (1-2-0). 
Terriers 4 Blizzard 3 (OT) 
Elkhorn’s Brad Bowles scored a hat trick for the second game in a row, including the winner 1:40 into overtime. The goal halted a furious Blizzard comeback that included two goals in the last four minutes to tie the game. Bowles’ twin brother, Shawn, had two assists for the Terriers (4-0-0). Devin Muir had a goal and an assist for the Blizzard (0-1-1) 
Blues 3 Stampeders 1 
Liam Kroeker scored a pair of goals and Brandon Wheat Kings draft pick James McIsaac supplied the other for the Blues (3-1-0). Evan Akkerman supplied the goal for the Stampeders (2-2-0) with 22 seconds left in the game. 
» The Brandon Sun
